messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Tia
messages.msgSnippet: ... Thanks Kelly.  I hope things go well with your mother.  It s sure an interesting journey, this role reversal we often have to do with our parents.  The one
messages.messageBody:
> {{{{{Tia}}}
> I am having a similar problem with my Mom, although
> not as severe, My thoughts are with you...

Thanks Kelly. I hope things go well with your mother. It's sure an
interesting journey, this role reversal we often have to do with our
parents. The one thing my mother feared the most was her body hanging
around after her mind was gone. It's not that far yet, by any means, but
it's a worry.
Tia

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Tia
messages.msgSnippet: ... I found a hole in the perimeter fence and crawled out.   I live on Vancouver Island near Victoria.  As to how I got *in* to Canada, the immigration laws
messages.messageBody:
> Hi Tia,
> I know this is off the topic at hand, but I wonder, where do you live now,
> and how did you get out of the US? Thanks. Curious. :)

I found a hole in the perimeter fence and crawled out. <g>
I live on Vancouver Island near Victoria. As to how I got *in* to Canada,
the immigration laws that we're criticized for by the US for making too lax
now, were a *lot* looser then. <G>

Now your email makes me think you're a musician or guitar maker or something
like that. Can I ask about that?
Tia

messages.subject: Tia
messages.messageBody:
<<I haven't lived in the US since 1970,

Tia>>

Hi Tia,
I know this is off the topic at hand, but I wonder, where do you live now,
and how did you get out of the US? Thanks. Curious. :)
~Alyce
